feedback_1_feedback: Congratulations - maybe we have another Usain Bolt on our hands!  Sprinters score highly for raw power, aggression and a single-minded determination to succeed
feedback_1_fact_1: A recent poll suggested that athletics is the fifth most popular sport in the United Kingdom in terms of television viewers and participating numbers
feedback_1_fact_2: Athletics contests in running, jumping, throwing and walking are among the oldest of all sports and their roots are prehistoric – stretching back as early as 2250 BC
feedback_1_fact_3: The sport of road running finds its roots in the activities of footmen – male servants who ran alongside the carriages of aristocrats around the 18th Century, and who also ran errands over distances for their masters
feedback_1_link_text: Get Inspired: Athletics in your area>
feedback_1_video_title: Our guide to athletics at the Commonwealth Games

feedback_5_feedback: The throwing events demand a lot from athletes.  You need a lot of raw power, and to be able to use it explosively.  But without technical ability to match your physical strength, you're not going to succeed
feedback_5_fact_1: A recent poll suggested that athletics is the fifth most popular sport in the United Kingdom in terms of television viewers and participating numbers

feedback_6_feedback: Tall, aggressive and single-minded? Shorter forms of swimming are right up your street
feedback_6_fact_1: A gentle swim can burn more than 400 calories in an hour; a fast front crawl can burn as many calories as an 8mph run
feedback_6_fact_2: Water is about 800 times denser than air, so you work your body harder than in many other sports - you also use all of the body's main muscles
feedback_6_fact_3: British Swimming say around three million Britons go for a dip at least once a week
feedback_6_link_text: Get Inspired: Swimming in your area>
feedback_6_video_title: Our guide to swimming at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_6_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_7_feedback: Your ability to put pain to one side, not to mention your mental strength in being able to focus on the task at hand, could help you succeed and enjoy longer swims.
feedback_7_fact_1: A gentle swim can burn more than 400 calories in an hour; a fast front crawl can burn as many calories as an 8mph run
feedback_7_fact_2: Water is about 800 times denser than air, so you work your body harder than in many other sports - you also use all of the body's main muscles

feedback_9_feedback: As with sprinters in athletics, sprint cyclists are powerful and able to effectively unleash their energy in short bursts
feedback_9_fact_1: Commuting on a bike at approximately 10mph will burn about 400 calories per hour
feedback_9_fact_2: The longest tandem bike ever built had 35 seats and was 67 feet long.
feedback_9_fact_3: 2.1m people in the UK ride their bike recreationally at least once a week. This number doesn't include the further 750,000 who use their bike to commute to work every day
feedback_9_link_text: Get Inspired: Cycling in your area>

feedback_10_feedback: As the distances increase in cycling, so does the amount of pain you are going to have to put up with.
feedback_10_fact_1: Commuting on a bike at approximately 10mph will burn about 400 calories per hour
feedback_10_fact_2: The longest tandem bike ever built had 35 seats and was 67 feet long.
feedback_10_fact_3: Around 2.1m people in the UK ride their bike recreationally at least once a week. This number doesn't include the further 750,000 who use their bike to commute to work every day

feedback_11_feedback: Pain tolerance and endurance are the most important qualities required in a long-distance cyclist, who typically compete in road races lasting three or more hours
feedback_11_fact_1: Commuting on a bike at approximately 10mph will burn about 400 calories per hour
feedback_11_fact_2: The longest tandem bike ever built had 35 seats and was 67 feet long.
feedback_11_fact_3: 2.1m people in the UK ride their bike recreationally at least once a week. This number doesn't include the further 750,000 who use their bike to commute to work every day

feedback_12_feedback: Endurance and pain tolerance are highly sought after in triathletes, who are very lean
feedback_12_fact_1: You typically burn 600-700 calories per hour during the swimming and cycling stages, and around 900 during the run
feedback_12_fact_2: There were nearly 1,000 triathlon events in the UK in 2013, more than ever before
feedback_12_fact_3: The average age of an amateur triathlete in the UK is 40-44. Slightly more than half of all triathletes come to the sport from a running background
feedback_12_link_text: Get Inspired: Triathlons in your area>
feedback_12_video_title: Our guide to the triathlon at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_12_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_13_feedback: If you rate youself highly in terms of aggression, power, pain tolerance and teamwork, then rugby sevens could be the perfect sport for you
feedback_13_fact_1: Invented by a Scottish butcher, Ned Haig, in 1883 at the Melrose Rugby Football Club
feedback_13_fact_2: Sevens players tend to be smaller and lighter than players of the 15-a-side game but are often faster and fitter
feedback_13_fact_3: Players will expend at least 300 calories in a 14-minute game. The intensity is very high with 85% of the time being spent above 85% max heart rate, demonstrating the high intensity nature, and very little recovery time between bouts
feedback_13_link_text: Get Inspired: Rugby in your area>
feedback_13_video_title: Our guide to rugby at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_13_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_14_feedback: Team-work, trust, agility and hand-eye co-ordination are all thrown into the mix when you put together the perfect hockey player
feedback_14_fact_1: Hockey in England can be dated back to at least 1363, when King Edward III made it illegal along with a number of other sports. The ball used to be cube-shaped
feedback_14_fact_2: During a match, players typically cover five miles
feedback_14_fact_3: The British Army helped spread hockey throughout the British Empire, which explains its popularity throughout the Commonwealth
feedback_14_link_text: Get Inspired: Hockey in your area>
feedback_14_video_title: Our guide to hockey at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_14_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_15_feedback: As with basketball, height is a big deal in netball - the taller the better. The two Cs - co-ordination and communication - are also considered to be very important
feedback_15_fact_1: Playing a game of netball will burn an average of 450 calories - the equivalent of 266g of cheese
feedback_15_fact_2: Tracey Neville has more England caps than her twin brother Phil Neville
feedback_15_fact_3: According to the International Netball Federation, around 20m people in more than 80 countries played the sport in 2011. There are 3,200 netball clubs across the UK
feedback_15_link_text: Get Inspired: Netball in your area>
feedback_15_video_title: Our guide to netball at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_15_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_16_feedback: Judokas have to keep their wits about them at all times, so the need to maintain focus is about as important as being very agile, and able to escape from tricky positions
feedback_16_fact_1: The most judo throws completed in one hour by a pair is 3,786 by British duo Dale Moore and Nigel Townsend in London on 23 February 2002
feedback_16_fact_2: The sport's founder, Jigoro Kanu, said the values of judo - mutual prosperity for self and others, and maximum efficient use of energy - were equally valid in all areas of life
feedback_16_fact_3: As one of the most diverse martial arts styles available, judo is both an Olympic and combat sport that translates to "the gentle way"
feedback_16_link_text: Get Inspired: Judo in your area>
feedback_16_video_title: Our guide to judo at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_16_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_17_feedback: Aggression, power, concentration and agility are of vital importance in wrestling
feedback_17_fact_1: Wrestling is considered the oldest sport on earth. It is depicted in cave drawings dating back to 3,000 BC
feedback_17_fact_2: Approximately 1,200 enthusiasts regularly take part in wrestling through the UK
feedback_17_fact_3: Ken Richmond (Vancouver, 1954) won England's first Commonwealth Games gold medal but is better known for being the shirtless man who bangs the enormous gong before Rank's British-made films
feedback_17_link_text: Get Inspired: Wrestling in your area>
feedback_17_video_title: Our guide to wrestling at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_17_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_18_feedback: You've got to be very aggressive to be a boxer, and agile too (in order to get yourself away from your opponent). Focus helps - one slip in concentration and you could be in trouble. An ability to withstand the pain of having a few blows landed upon you is also vital
feedback_18_fact_1: Working out on a heavy bag can burn between 354 and 558 calories per hour
feedback_18_fact_2: Hollywood actor Mickey Rourke won six fights, with no losses and five knockouts between 1991-1994
feedback_18_fact_3: At 113.7, the bout between Ireland's Katie Taylor and England's Natasha Jonas registered the highest decibel level of any sport during the Olympic Games. The roar of a typical jet engine is 140
feedback_18_link_text: Get Inspired: Boxing in your area>
feedback_18_video_title: Our guide to boxing at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_18_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_19_feedback: Agility, hand-eye co-ordination, and endurance are what's needed in squash - and it appears you score highly in all three categories
feedback_19_fact_1: In one hour of squash, a player can expect to expend 600-1,000 calories
feedback_19_fact_2: Legendary squash player Jahangir Khan once went five years unbeaten, winning 555 straight matches – a world sports record
feedback_19_fact_3: Australian Cameron Philley holds the world record for the fastest squash shot of all time, at 175mph
feedback_19_link_text: Get Inspired: Squash in your area>
feedback_19_video_title: Our guide to squash at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_19_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_20_feedback: As with all racquet sports, excellent hand-eye co-ordination and cat-like agility will serve you well in badminton
feedback_20_fact_1: The average distance travelled by a player in a game is 3.7 miles, with an hour's play likely to burn around 544 calories.
feedback_20_fact_2: It's officially the fastest racquet sport in the world. The shuttle is smashed around the court at speeds of up to 200mph
feedback_20_fact_3: The Chinese originally played a version of badminton called Ti Zian Ji. They didn't have racquets though, they used their feet instead
feedback_20_link_text: Get Inspired: Badminton in your area>
feedback_20_video_title: Our guide to badminton at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_20_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_21_feedback: Focused? Check. Highly agile? Check. Excellent hand-eye co-ordination? Check. Table tennis is just the sport for you
feedback_21_fact_1: In the 19th Century, table tennis was played using the names of Gossima and Whiff-Whaff
feedback_21_fact_2: Elite players playing table tennis for one hour burn up to 500 calories
feedback_21_fact_3: Top players often smash the ball at speeds exceeding 100mph
feedback_21_link_text: Get Inspired: Table tennis in your area>
feedback_21_video_title: Our guide to table tennis at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_21_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_22_feedback: Along with shooting, lawn bowls is able to be played at a good level by people in a wide age range. Excellent levels of hand-eye co-ordination and focus are needed to succeed though, whatever your age
feedback_22_fact_1: Mainly an anaerobic sport because you are not giving your cardiovascular system a workout
feedback_22_fact_2: During an average game you can walk up to three miles
feedback_22_fact_3: It dates back to at least the thirteenth century and has been banned twice in England: by Edward III in 1361 and by Henry VIII in 1511
feedback_22_link_text: Get Inspired: Lawn bowls in your area>
feedback_22_video_title: Our guide to lawn bowling at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_22_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_23_feedback: Supreme levels of concentration and focus are required if you are to hit the mark in shooting
feedback_23_fact_1: Shooting is one of few sports you can take up later in life and still get to the top
feedback_23_fact_2: Clay target shooting is one of the only sports where you try to hit something moving away from you
feedback_23_fact_3: Shooting is one of the most inclusive sports - around 20% of participants have some form of disability. People with dyslexia are often very accurate marksmen
feedback_23_link_text: Get Inspired: Shooting in your area>
feedback_23_video_title: Our guide to shooting at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_23_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_24_feedback: Focused, brave and in perfect control of your body?  Diving is perfect for you - chucking yourself off a platform up to 10m above your local swimming pool sounds ideal
feedback_24_fact_1: Diving from a 10m board, you will hit the water at 30mph
feedback_24_fact_2: Hardman actor Jason Statham is a former Great Britain diving international
feedback_24_fact_3: The sound of a perfect entry is called a rip because of the noise the water makes when the diver hits it
feedback_24_link_text: Get Inspired: Diving in your area>
feedback_24_video_title: Our guide to diving at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_24_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_25_feedback: Aggressive, powerful and in control of your body? Good at focusing on the task at hand? Why not give weightlifting a go, because you appear to be a natural
feedback_25_fact_1: Weightlifting burns an average of 230 calories/hour
feedback_25_fact_2: World record holder Ali Jawad can bench press 190kg - more than three times his own weight
feedback_25_fact_3: Women's weightlifting was only introduced to the Olympic programme from the Sydney 2000 Games
feedback_25_link_text: Get Inspired: Weightlifting in your area>
feedback_25_video_title: Our guide to weightlifting at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_25_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
feedback_26_feedback: Gymnasts are typically very focused people who like to be in perfect control of their bodies. Agility and power are all pre-requisites for success in this demanding sport
feedback_26_fact_1: Gymnastics was first included in the Commonwealth Games in 1978 in Edmonton
feedback_26_fact_2: Rhythmic Gymnastics was first included in the Commonwealth Games programme in 1990 in Auckland
feedback_26_fact_3: One of the most remarkable athletes in gymnastics history is George Eyser (USA) who won six Olympic medals in 1904 with a wooden prosthesis for a left leg, having lost his real one after being run over by a train
feedback_26_video_title: Our guide to gymnastics at the Commonwealth Games
feedback_26_video_playlist: If you have a video, put the playlist URL here and set the above field to TRUE
